generalInfo:
Be some of the first to experience the remote reefs of Halmahera in northern Indonesia. On this snorkeling tour we will spend our time gliding over the vibrant shallow coral reefs of this secluded corner of Indonesia while we indulge in all the amenities and comforts of our boutique tropical island resort.

Halmahera is the large odd-shaped island just west of the Raja Ampat area. The area we’ll be exploring is in the south around a small island called Kusu Island. This area is fantastic for snorkeling, offering us unlimited access to a truly amazing house reef and of course all the other nearby reefs which are only 5-20 minutes by boat. Halmahera is relatively new on the snorkeling scene as the area just didn’t have the infrastructure to support tourism really at any level. Now, with several small airports and this one brand-new resort, we can indulge in the endless reefs, clouds of colorful reef fish, the lush tropical environment, and delicious food day after day.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at the Jakarta Airport (CGK). Make your way to our Jakarta Hotel where you can check in and relax. Meet your tour leader and the rest of the group over a nice group dinner.

After a big breakfast at the hotel, we will check out and catch our flight to Labuha where we will be met by the Kusu Island Resort staff and transferred to the harbor where we will hop on a private shuttle boat which will take us to the resort, 30 minutes away. After settling into your water villas, we’ll meet for lunch in the resort’s restaurant where we’ll enjoy a resort and general snorkel briefing before heading out for an afternoon snorkel on the resort’s house reef.

Each day begins with coffee, tea, or juice as well as a breakfast cookie being delivered to your front porch, followed by a delicious breakfast in the main restaurant before our first snorkel session of the day. Each snorkel session will run for 60 – 75 minutes. With the exception of the house reef, all the snorkel sites are accessed by the resort’s quick and comfortable speedboats. Snorkel sites are close, with the furthest sites being a maximum of 30 minutes away. Nearly all the sites though are 5-10 minutes from the resort. All the snorkel sessions have surface boat support, allowing you to jump in the boat whenever you feel like it. There will be local guides and your tour leader in the water on all snorkels, pointing out interesting things to see and assisting with whatever you may need. They will also enter the water to do a current check and decide if our plan should be altered slightly or if we will snorkel in that spot. If there is current, we will always drift with it. The snorkel boats can always pick us up down current at the end of the snorkel. After our snorkel, we return to the resort for a delicious lunch. After a little post-lunch siesta we’ll prepare for the second snorkel session of the day, followed by more snacks! You will not go hungry on this safari. For those who are keen, we can also organize a sunset or night snorkel on the house reef or one of the other nearby reefs. We will offer 2 guided boat snorkel sessions a day. You are not obliged to participate in them all. Throughout our time at Kusu Island Resort the house reef is open for snorkeling any time you choose. Dinner is a 3-course meal. Evenings are spent looking through fish ID books, reviewing the day’s photos and sightings, chatting in the spacious lounge, or enjoying the night sky from your giant porch.

On the final day of the trip will check out of the resort together and transfer to the Labuha Airport for a flight back to Jakarta where we will bid farewell to one another. Please speak to a member of our team if you would like to extend your time in Indonesia, either for more snorkeling or land tours.
